generic.nolicense: Open vStorage Backend is unlicensed. It will be impossible to claim disks which will cause the backend to be unavailable. Please request a Community License to start using this backend.

osdinfo.uninitialized: This is a raw block device that's not yet in use
osdinfo.initialized: This ASD is running but not yet discovered
osdinfo.available: This ASD is ready to be claimed/in use by the backend
osdinfo.unavailable: This ASD is claimed/in use by another backend
osdinfo.error: This ASD is in error state. Action is required
osdinfo.warning: This ASD is in warning state. Action may be needed
osdinfo.claimed: This ASD is in use by this backend

dashboard.title: Open vStorage Backends
dashboard.helpcontent: This panel displays the state of all Open vStorage Backends managed by this cluster. It shows how many ASDs are in use by the backend, grouped by their state.

policies.helpcontent:
Each available policy (e.g. [5,2,3]) consists out of 3 numbers:
  • k: The amount of data fragments (e.g. 5)
  • m: The amount of parity fragments (e.g. 2)
  • x: The maximum number of fragments per storage node (e.g. 3)
For example, [5,2,3] means each object will be split in 7 fragments (5 data and 2 parity) which will be stored across all available disks. However, no more than 3 fragments will end up within a single storage node. In case this policy can not be met, the policy will be unavailable. If no policies are available, the backend can not be used.

Colors:
  • Grey: This policy is unavailable with the current disk configuration.
  • Green: New objects will be stored using this policy.
  • Black: This policy is available, but not used as a better policy is available.
  • Orange: This policy is degraded, loosing one more disk will cause dataloss.
  • Red: This policy has insufficient disks, data written using this policy is lost.
Icons:
  • : This policy is not in use.
  • : This policy is in use: objects have been written using this policy.
policies.inuse: This policy is in use: objects have been written using this policy
policies.notinuse: This policy is not in use

initializeall.warning: Are you sure you want to initialize all uninitialized disks?
initializeall.somefailed: Some disks could not be initialized: __which__

impact.newpolicy: __what__ will become the active safety policy.
impact.nopolicy: There is no policy matching the new disk configuration. This backend will become unavailable.
impact.lostpolicies: Objects written with the following policies will be lost: __what__

remove.warning: Are you sure you want to remove the following disk? __what__ __info__

claim.warning: Are you sure you want to claim the following disk? __what__ __info__

claimall.warning: Are you sure you want to claim the following disks? __which__ __info__

gather.asdipshelp: Select the ips on which the ASDs should listen. Select nothing for to listen on all ips.
gather.basicinfo: Enter the required information to add the ASD node
